subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Safavid Empire: Shia Islam's Kingdom
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Safavid Empire: Shia Islam's Kingdom.

hook.text: Iran wasn't always Shia. One dynasty forced the conversion. The Safavids made Iran the Shia heartland it is today.

buildup.text: The Safavid dynasty (1501-1736) declared Shia Islam Iran's official religion. Sunni scholars were exiled or killed.

discovery.text: Isfahan became one of the world's most beautiful cities. Persian art, poetry, and architecture reached new heights.

twist.text: The forced conversion created a permanent Sunni-Shia geopolitical divide that still drives Middle Eastern conflict.

climax.text: The Safavids prove that state power can reshape religious identity. Iran's Shia character is only 500 years old.

punchline.text: Iran became Shia by force 500 years ago. That choice still shapes the world.

quiz.question: What did the Safavid Empire do?
options: Made Shia Islam Iran's official religion
